title: Welcome! 欢迎！
text:
Welcome! 欢迎！
My name is Andrew Zhao and I am a PhD student in the Travers Department of Political Science at UC Berkeley. I research how politics intersects with questions of who we are.



Dinosaur Provincial Park, Alberta

title: About
text:
I am a PhD student in The Charles and Louise Travers Department of Political Science at UC Berkeley, where I am also a Citrin Fellow at the Jack Citrin Center for Public Opinion Research and a Hildebrand Fellow at the Canadian Studies Program.
I am broadly interested in identity and politics. Lately, I have been thinking about how politics make and remake racial categories, and how these categories then shape politics.
I earned my Honours Bachelor of Arts from the University of Toronto,1 where I received the Suzanne and Edwin Goodman Prize as the top graduating student in the political science specialization.
I grew up on the prairies in Treaty 7 territory. The photo here is of me and my dog Hector after taking a dip in the Red Deer River, nestled in the badlands.

title: Andrew Zhao
text:
I am an incoming PhD student in The Charles and Louise Travers Department of Political Science at UC Berkeley, where I will also be a Citrin Fellow. I earned my Honours Bachelor of Arts from the University of Toronto.
I am broadly interested in the interplay between race & ethnicity, immigration, and political participation. Specifically, I am interested in understanding barriers to participation and developing interventions to overcome those barriers.1
I grew up on the prairies in Treaty 7 territory. The picture here is of me and my dog Hector after taking a dip in the Red River, nestled in the badlands.
